definition: Amu Darya, the biggest river of Central Asia, from Pamir to Aral sea, forming the boundary between Afghanistan and Tajikistan then flowing through Turkmenistan and Uzbekistan/formerly called Oxus by Greek and Western writers, and Gihon by medieval Islamic writers
prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]
abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]
woman who looks after small children/(old) female tutor

sentences.english: We looked out across the river, to the majestic Amu.
sentences.chinese: 我们远眺向河，宏伟的阿姆河。

sentences.english: The Aral Sea gets almost all its water from the Amu and Syr rivers.
sentences.chinese: 咸海的水源几乎完全来自阿姆河和锡尔河。

sentences.english: The Amu Darya and Pyanj rivers mark the border with Afghanistan.
sentences.chinese: 阿姆河和菲尔尼甘河与阿富汗交界。

definition: Syr Darya, Central Asian river, flowing from Kyrgiz Republic through Kazakhstan to the Aral sea
the Ferghana Valley in modern Uzbekistan
pinyin: Fei4 er3 gan4 na4 Pen2 di4

definition: Talas River, originating in Kyrgyzstan and flowing west into Kazakhstan
Bokhara or Bukhara city in Uzbekistan
the Ferghana valley (in Uzbekistan, central Asia)
old name for the Pamir high plateau 帕米爾高原|帕米尔高原[Pa4 mi3 er3 Gao1 yuan2] on the border between Xinjiang and Tajikistan
